body:
Thanks @kachkaev 

> After upgrading from `"next": "10.0.3"/ "next": "10.0.5"` to `"next": "10.0.6"` and running `yarn install`:
> 
> ```
> yarn why webpack
> yarn why v1.22.10
> [1/4] ðŸ¤”  Why do we have the module "webpack"...?
> [2/4] ðŸšš  Initialising dependency graph...
> [3/4] ðŸ”  Finding dependency...
> error We couldn't find a match!
> âœ¨  Done in 0.89s.
> ```
> 
> Adding `"webpack": "^4.46.0"` to `package.json` dependencies provided a workaround.

 If anyone  getting this error  
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/37132588/106354989-6aae3280-631b-11eb-8be3-0cf5bdc1c91d.png)

Find below steps

1.  Install `"webpack": "^5.19.0"` in devDependencies 
2.   Add in next.config.js ` future: {
    webpack5: true,
  },`
